snippet: Once a student at St. John’s University School of Law, David Powers failed to disclose that he had once been charged with selling drugs; after the school rescinded his acceptance, he sued.
abstract: Lawsuit brought by onetime student David Powers against St John's University for expelling him halfway through his coursework after revelation that he was once drug addict highlights push to limit information employers and schools can request about applicant's criminal background; school, which alleges Powers lied by admitting drug use on his application but omitting dropped charge of drug sales, wins court case.
lead_paragraph: Once a student at St. John’s University School of Law, David Powers failed to disclose that he had once been charged with selling drugs; after the school rescinded his acceptance, he sued.

headline.main: Past Drug Charges Derail a Law Student’s Education
